meanings.definition: To change back or exchange again.
meanings.sent1: After realizing the mistake, she quickly started rechanging her clothes.
meanings.sent2: I am rechanging my mind about going to the party tonight.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept rechanging the colors of the scarves, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The seasons seem to be rechanging faster every year, like a spinning top.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon's ability to rechange its skin color is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The act of changing back or exchanging again.
meanings.sent1: The rechanging of the faulty product was done without any hassle.
meanings.sent2: I observed the rechanging of the decorations for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The constant rechanging of the traffic lights confused the drivers.
meanings.sent4: The rechanging of roles in the play added an interesting twist to the story.
meanings.sent5: The rechanging of the seasons brought a sense of nostalgia to the town.
